ai-ud8.3:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud8.3:1.3_0: Now at that time the Buddha was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dhamma talk.
ai-ud8.3:1.4_0: And those mendicants were paying heed, paying attention, engaging wholeheartedly, and lending an ear.
ai-ud8.3:2.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud8.3:3.1_0: “There is, monks, an unborn, unbecome, unmade, unconditioned.
ai-ud8.3:3.2_0: If there were no escape from the born, unproduced, unmade, and unconditioned, an escape is found from the born, created, conditioned, and made.
ai-ud8.3:3.3_0: But since there is an unborn, unproduced, unmade, and unconditioned, an escape is found from the born, produced, made, and conditioned.”
